channel.title: ElMuso - Music Theory blog with free (and legal) material
channel.description: Recent content on ElMuso - Music Theory blog with free (and legal) material

item.title: El ABC de la Teoría Musical Volume 1
item.description:
Download here the Second edition of this book, with little fixes and new lessons adapted to a modern language and context.

CC 4.0 N.C

item.title: El ABC de la Teoría Musical Volume 2
item.description:
Download here the Second edition of this book’s 2nd volume, with lessons that deserved its own little space.

CC 4.0 N.C

item.title: Music Theory exercises 1 & 2
item.description:
This book is made of exercises designed specifically to measure the level of knoweledge aquired by the first and second volume of “El ABC de la teoría musical”

CC 4.0 N.C

item.title: El ABC de la Teoría Musical 1º Edition
item.description:
This is the first edition of my music theory book. A compilation of music theory lineal lessons , from a personal perspective and unique. With some redaction errors… and in spanish.

CC 4.0 N.C

item.title: De Obras Bolivianas 1º Edition
item.description:
This is the first edition of this recopilation, it contains some arrangements and transcriptions of original sheets for piano. In total 12 music pieces. For interested people.

CC 4.0 N.C

item.title: About me
item.description: ¡Hi! I’m El Muso, but of course, that’s not my real name. I’m a musician, writer and researcher in my free time, right now I’m still studying music, but at the same time I give some time to make content intermittently Asides that, I’m a content creator that sometimes is a little impulsive and that is the reason of my adventure in social networks, showing that music theory doesn’t need to be hard.

item.title: Licencias
item.description: All the content distributed here is under: Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0) You are free to: Share — copy and redistribute the material in any medium or format Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material Under the following terms: Attribution — You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use.
